resources.string: By Zheng Haotian (aka Justin Fincher) From FinGameWorks

The behavior of flowing particles is data-driven. Simply set as wallpaper and this app will pull weather and location info from Google Awareness API. Normally Vortex refreshes these data every 30 minutes if there is a good network connectivity. You can long press each item of the Awareness data to see how it affects the whole living particle system.
Coordinate data is used to determine the weather and the sunrise / sunset time
If temperature goes up, particles moves faster
Humidity decides the base size of a swirl
Sunrise / Sunset time, along with last refreshed time, change the color of particle lines
Activity (still / walking / running) have a minor impact on the particle speed.
Weather (cloudy / raining) have a minor impact on the particle speed and the default size of noises.
Please install GMS manually or contact your OEM manufacturer for resolution
Google Play Service is needed but currently not available on this device
Location and physical activity permissions are needed for Google Awareness API.
Enable this would let particles move fast
Calculated from current weather, temperature, time, and human motion data, the force field in Vortex drives whirling trails in a spectacular fashion.
Press the red round floating button to set Vortex as system wallpaper
Vortex is not set as system wallpaper

If you want to set another live wallpaper other than Vortex, please first exit this one, or Vortex will continue to pull data from Google Awareness API in the background, which is fine actually but you can complete shut down Vortex if you want.
